messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Hornet Drive.
Okay, do you need medical and police assistance?
Medical and police.
Okay, what's going on at Hornet Drive?
I've been called over to my father-in-law's house because he got off the phone with my mother-in-law, and he's been slicing himself up and attempting to commit suicide.
Okay. I was here previously, and he was tearing up the house. He's drunk and belligerent.
He's been off his medication.
Okay. Are you inside the residence now?
I'm standing outside the residence off the property.
Oh, you're standing outside. Okay. Is he inside the house alone?
He is.
Okay. Is he making threats or has he actually hurt himself?
He's threatened my wife. He said he's cutting himself up and he's bleeding.
Oh, he is? Okay. How long ago did he say that?
Within the last five to ten minutes.
Okay, and how are you related to him again?
I'm his son-in-law.
What's his name?
Larry Clay.
Do you know what he's cutting himself with?
A kitchen knife, likely.
Okay, and nobody's there but him and the dog?
Correct.
All right, I'm not really in a position to enter the house because I'm carrying a concealed weapon.
No, yeah, I wouldn't. You should know that he has threatened suicide by cop.
He has done this before about 10 or 12 years ago.
Okay. And what's his name again?
Larry Clay.
How old is he?
Does he have any other weapons in the house?
No firearms that I know of, but possibly tools.
Okay, there's a lot of blood, apparently. How do you know that?
My wife is talking to her mom, who is his wife.
Is he coming outside?
He's standing on the front porch, motioning suicide threats to me.
He's on the front porch now?
Yes. He's approaching me.
Okay, are you going to stay back or get away?
I'm walking backwards.
Yeah, stay away. It sounds like he's playing music so loud he can't hear you. Is that right?
Yes, he's very intoxicated. He's been drinking since 4 p.m.
Okay, and you said he's 48, right?
Yes.
Is he back in the house now?
Yes, he's gone back inside.
Okay, stay away. Let me know if he comes back out.
Okay, he's on the outside porch now, facing Hornet Drive.
Can you see the knife?
Yes, one in each hand.
Okay, he's ready to die, stating it very intoxicated, wiping the knives, asking to be shot.
Yes, he's saying these things in a speaking voice.
Okay, we're letting officers know. We have a lot of units headed that way.
Thank you. I'm a law enforcement supporter myself.
They know to approach with caution. Has he done this kind of thing before?
Yes, about 10 or 12 years ago he was in a hostage standoff with police.
Okay, does he have any firearms now?
No, just knives.
Okay, keep monitoring from a distance. Let us know if anything changes.
He's now around the back of the house, I lost visual.
Okay, that's fine. Stay safe.
I can hear him still making noise.
All right, just keep your distance. Help is on the way.
